{{about|the American television Anchor}} {{Infobox person |name = Greg Kelly |image = |image_size = |caption = |birth_name = Gregory Raymond Kelly |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1968|12|17}} |birth_place = [[Garden City, New York|Garden City]], [[New York (state)|New York]] |nationality = [[United States|American]] |other_names = |spouse = Judith Grey Kelly |education = [[Fordham University]] |employer = [[WNYW]] Fox 5 |occupation = Former [[Good Day New York]] Co-anchor with [[Rosanna Scotto]] (2008-2017) U.S. Marine Corps officer |height = |weight = |website = [http://www.myfoxny.com/dpp/about_us/personalities/Greg_Kelly ''Fox 5 NY'' profile] }} '''Gregory Raymond "Greg" Kelly ''' (born December 17, 1968) is an American News Anchor. He most recently was the co-host of [[Good Day New York]] on Fox 5 NY [[WNYW]] with [[Rosanna Scotto]]. Previously, he was the co-host of ''[[Fox and Friends]]'' and [[White House press corps|White House correspondent]] for [[Fox News]]. Kelly is also a lieutenant colonel in the [[Marine Forces Reserve|U.S. Marine Corps Reserves]]. In November 2017 Kelly married Judith Grey, an Australian creative director.
==Journalist== In the late 1990s, Kelly was an anchor for the morning news program at [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] affiliate [[WIVT|WIVT-TV]] in [[Binghamton, New York]], where he secured an exclusive interview with then U.S. President [[Bill Clinton]]. Later, Kelly was a political reporter for [[NY1]] in [[New York City]], where he covered the [[New York City mayoral election, 2001|2001 mayoral campaign]], and provided extensive live reports from [[Ground Zero]] on [[September 11, 2001]]. Kelly joined [[Fox News]] soon afterward.
In 2003, during [[Iraq War|Operation Iraqi Freedom]], Kelly was an embedded reporter with the [[United States Army]]'s [[U.S. 3rd Infantry Division|3rd Infantry Division]], 2nd Brigade. He received a minor [[Shrapnel shell|shrapnel]] wound to the face when a [[Mortar (weapon)|mortar round]] exploded near him while crossing the [[Euphrates River]] with the 3rd Infantry Division on March 31, 2003.
Kelly was the first television journalist to broadcast live pictures of U.S. military forces reaching [[Baghdad]] on April 5, 2003. Information Minister [[Muhammad Said al-Sahhaf]], a.k.a. [[Baghdad Bob]], was shown at one of his press conferences saying that Coalition forces were not in Baghdad, Fox News was showing, in split screen, reporter Kelly riding a tank through the city. Two days later, Kelly captured another exclusive during the storming of [[Saddam Hussein]]'s [[Presidential Palace, Baghdad|presidential palace]].
His reporting assignments have brought him back to [[Iraq]] numerous times, as well as to [[Gaza City|Gaza]], [[Pakistan]], the [[United Arab Emirates]], and [[Kuwait]].
Kelly was a host of ''[[Good Day New York]]'' from 2008 through June 2012 when he was promoted to the 6 and 10 pm news, on Fox 5.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20171107181356/http://gothamist.com/2012/06/29/greg_kellys_good_day_new_york_farew.php Greg Kelly's Good Day NY Farewell] by Garth Johnston, The Gothamist, June 29, 2012</ref> David Price was announced as his replacement. On January 24, 2013, it was announced that [[Dave Price]] would be leaving ''[[Good Day New York]]'' and Kelly would be returning.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/greg-kelly-returning-anchor-ch-5-good-day-new-york-article-1.1247005 | location=New York | work=Daily News | title=Greg Kelly back to mornings on Ch. 5/WNYW, replaces Dave Price alongside Rosanna Scotto}}</ref>
On September 28, 2017, Kelly announced he was leaving ''Good Day New York''. It is said he will be replaced by former [[WABC-TV]] anchor [[Lori Stokes]]. On Friday, September 29, 2017, Greg Kelly carried out the last appearance on ''Good Day New York'' with his long-time Co-Host [[Rosanna Scotto]].
==Personal life== Kelly is a native of [[Garden City, New York]]. His father is former [[New York City Police Commissioner]], [[Raymond W. Kelly]]. Kelly graduated from [[Fordham University]] with a [[Bachelor of Arts|B.A.]] in [[political science]]. While attending Fordham, Kelly worked at [[WFUV]] as an on-air reporter.
In Januaryâ€“February 2012 Kelly was investigated by the [[Manhattan District Attorney]]'s office upon an accusation of rape.<ref>[http://abcnews.go.com/US/tv-anchor-greg-kelly-raped-made-pregnant-accuser/story?id=15444798 TV's Greg Kelly Raped Me, Made Me Pregnant, Accuser Told Investigators] abcnews.go.com. 26 January 2012. Retrieved on 27 January 2012.</ref> All allegations were dropped<ref name="Newsday 2012-02-07">{{cite news|last=Chayes|first=Matthew|date=7 February 2012|title=Official: No rape charges for Greg Kelly|url=http://www.newsday.com/news/new-york/official-no-rape-charges-for-greg-kelly-1.3512474|newspaper=[[Newsday]]|accessdate=28 December 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2012/02/07/greg-kelly-will-not-be-charged-with-rape/ | work=Fox News | title=Prosecutors decline to press rape charges against NYPD commissioner's son Greg Kelly | date=7 February 2012}}</ref> and Kelly returned to work February 13.
On June 9, 2014, Kelly's accuser spoke publicly for the first time about her 2012 allegations against Kelly.<ref>https://www.buzzfeed.com/jtes/she-accused-a-tv-anchor-of-rape-and-got-dragged-through-the</ref>
Kelly is married to Judith Gray, a creative director in advertising. They were married on November 12, 2017 at New York's University Club.<ref name="Kelly_Wedding">{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=Emily|title=Greg Kelly and Judith Grey tie the knot|url=https://pagesix.com/2017/11/13/greg-kelly-and-judith-grey-tie-the-knot/|work=Page Six|agency=Page Six|publisher=New York Post|date=14 November 2017}}</ref>
==Military career== Kelly is an officer in the [[Marine Forces Reserve|U.S. Marine Corps Reserves]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,74735,00.html | work=Fox News | title=Greg Kelly | date=19 February 2008}}</ref> During his tour of active duty military service between 1991-2000 he was a pilot of a [[AV-8 Harrier II|AV-8B Harrier jump jet]] assigned to the [[VMA-211|Marine Attack Squadron 211]], the "[[Battle of Wake Island|Wake Island]] Avengers". While on duty Kelly successfully amassed over 158 aircraft carrier landings and flew over [[Iraq]] in [[Operation Southern Watch]], enforcing the [[United Nations]] imposed [[Iraqi no-fly zones|No-Fly Zone]].<ref name="Kelly_MarineCorp">{{cite news|last1=Mallozzi|first1=Vincent M.|title=A Good Day in New York for a Former TV Anchor|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/24/fashion/weddings/ex-tv-anchor-greg-kelly-weds-judith-grey.html|work=The New York Times|agency=New York Times|date=24 November 2017}}</ref>
